briefdescription.para: A syntax sugar for struct AllocatorInterface_s.

detaileddescription.para: Defines an interface to standardize custom allocators implementation.

briefdescription.para: A function to allocate memory using an AllocatorInterface.

detaileddescription.para: This funcion calls the allocator alloc function passing the necessary parameters.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to an AllocatorInterface.
the size of memory block to be allocated in bytes.

simplesect.para: a pointer to the allocated memory block or null in failure cases.

briefdescription.para: A function to reallocate memory using an AllocatorInterface.

detaileddescription.para: This funcion calls the allocator realloc function passing the necessary parameters.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to an AllocatorInterface.
pointer to the block that will be reallocated.
the new size for the memory block in bytes.
pointer to the memory block after reallocated or to null in failure case.

simplesect.para: 0 in failure case or 1 in sucess case.

briefdescription.para: A function to deallocate memory using an AllocatorInterface.

detaileddescription.para: This funcion calls the allocator dealloc function passing the necessary parameters.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to an AllocatorInterface.
pointer to the block that will be deallocated.

briefdescription.para: A function that gets the size of an allocated block.

detaileddescription.para: This funcion calls the allocator get_size function passing the necessary parameters.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to an AllocatorInterface.
pointer to the block.

simplesect.para: the size of the block in bytes.

briefdescription.para: Utility function that provides a pointer to the default memory allocator in the process.

detaileddescription.para: By default this function will return a pointer to an allocator interface that uses the functions provided by the libc (eg. malloc, realloc and free). The default allocator can be changed using the

briefdescription.para: Utility function that provides a pointer to the default memory allocator in the process.

detaileddescription.para: By default this function will return a pointer to an allocator interface that uses the functions provided by the libc (eg. malloc, realloc and free). The default allocator can be changed using the

briefdescription.para: Allocates a memory block using the libc malloc function.

parameterdescription.para: the size of block to be allocated in bytes.

simplesect.para: a pointer to the allocated memory block or null in failure cases.
The function called depends on the compiler used and target operating system.

briefdescription.para: Reallocates a memory block using the libc realloc function.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to the block that will be reallocated.
the new size for the memory block in bytes.
pointer to the memory block after reallocated or to null in failure case.

simplesect.para: 0 in failure case or 1 in sucess case.
The function called depends on the compiler used and target operating system.

briefdescription.para: Releases a memory block using the libc free function.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to the block that will be deallocated.

simplesect.para: The function called depends on the compiler used and target operating system.

briefdescription.para: Allocates a memory block on stack.

parameterdescription.para: the size of block to be allocated in bytes.

simplesect.para: a pointer to the allocated memory block or null in failure cases.
The function called depends on the compiler used and target operating system.

briefdescription.para: Reallocates a memory block on stack.

detaileddescription.para: Internally, this function will allocate a new block on stack, copy the data from old block to the new and try to dealloc the old block, be aware that some runtimes doesn't allow manually stack release, in such cases both memory blocks will be allocated until the end of scope.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to the block that will be reallocated.
the new size for the memory block in bytes.
pointer to the memory block after reallocated or to null in failure case.

simplesect.para: 0 in failure case or 1 in sucess case.
The function called depends on the compiler used and target operating system.

briefdescription.para: Releases a memory block on stack.

detaileddescription.para: Be aware that some runtimes doesn't allow manually stack release, in such cases this function does nothing.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to the block that will be deallocated.

simplesect.para: The function called depends on the compiler used and target operating system.

briefdescription.para: A function that gets the size of an allocated block.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to the block.

simplesect.para: the size of the block in bytes.
The function called depends on the compiler used and target operating system.

briefdescription.para: Indicates if a sequence of bytes from two adress have the same value.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to an adress.
pointer to an adress.
lenght of sequence to be compared.

simplesect.para: 1 if are equals and 0 if not.

memberdef.argsstring: (const void *const src, void *const dest, size_t src_size, size_t dest_size)
memberdef.name: cff_memcpy

briefdescription.para: Copy a sequence of bytes from src to dest.

detaileddescription.para: If the dest and src buffers overlaps use the cff_memmove instead.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to the adress of the data to be copied.
pointer to the adress that will receive the copy.
lenght of bytes that will be copied.
lenght of bytes of the block that will receive the copy.

memberdef.argsstring: (const void *const src, void *const dest, size_t src_size, size_t dest_size)
memberdef.name: cff_memmove

briefdescription.para: Moves a sequence of bytes from src to dest.

detaileddescription.para: Better option when the src and dest buffer overlaps.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to the adress of the data to be copied.
pointer to the adress that will receive the copy.
lenght of bytes that will be copied.
lenght of bytes of the block that will receive the copy.

briefdescription.para: Sets all values of an memory block to a value.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to a memory block.
value to be setted in every byte of the block.
lenght of bytes to be setted.

memberdef.argsstring: (const void *const a, const void *const b, size_t size)
memberdef.name: cff_memcmp_8

briefdescription.para: Indicates if a sequence of bytes from two adress have the same value 8 bits at a time.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to the adress of the data to be copied.
pointer to the adress that will receive the copy.
lenght of sequence to be compared.

simplesect.para: 1 if are equals and 0 if not.

memberdef.argsstring: (const void *const a, const void *const b, size_t size)
